patterns: What is the COEP Satellite (SWAYAM) project?
Can you provide information about the COEP Satellite project?
How does the COEP Satellite project work?
Tell me about the achievements of the Satellite Team.
Who are the key members of the Satellite Team?
responses: The COEP Satellite (SWAYAM) project is aimed at developing a reliable bidirectional communications platform using a cube-shaped satellite destined to orbit the Earth at a height of 500-800 km.
The SWAYAM project revolves around the challenge of building a pico-satellite with a total weight of 1 kg and volume restricted to around 1000 cc.
The COEP Satellite houses a payload capable of half duplex communication over the HAM frequency band, enabling it to receive, store, and transmit messages globally.
The Satellite Team has achieved milestones such as successfully clearing the Critical Design Review (CDR), completing the Flight Model assembly, and launching the satellite into space.
Key members of the Satellite Team include Project Manager Harshmohan Kulkarni and Faculty Advisor Ms. N. R. Kolhare.

Projects completed by the Drama and Film Club include theatrical performances such as 'Na Bhuto Na Bhavishyati' and short films like 'Aabhas', 'One Last Time', 'Abhay', and 'PopUp', along with documentaries and interactive videos.
Key members of the Drama and Film Club include Secretary Nikash Deshmukh and Faculty Advisor Prof. S. S. Kumbhar.

patterns: What are some achievements of the Satellite Team?
Can you list the accomplishments of the COEP Satellite Team?
Tell me about the successes of the COEP Satellite project.
responses: Achievements of the Satellite Team include:
- Successfully clearing the Critical Design Review (CDR)
- Completing the Flight Model assembly
- Launching the satellite into space
The team has also established a functional Ground Station and tracked many amateur radio satellites.

patterns: What is the Training and Placement process at COEP?
Can you provide an overview of the Training and Placement cell?
Tell me about the recruitment process at COEP.
responses: The Training and Placement cell at COEP is led by Dr. Raju N. Ladhwe, the Training and Placement Officer.
COEP Technological University, Pune, aims to be a leader amongst engineering institutions in India.
The Training and Placement cell invites organizations to recruit from the current batch of students, providing a platform for students to showcase their talents.
COEP has established lasting relationships with numerous organizations, and invites them to visit the campus for recruitment.
For more details, visit www.coep.org.in or contact the Training and Placement Officer at tpo@coeptech.ac.in.
